result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick J. Peterson

records.addlTxt:
10:05 AM cases 20CF1512, 21CF101, 21CF118, 21CF210, 22CF119, 22CF553, 22CF885, 22CF1003 called. Prosecuting Attorney Trenton John Piltz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derrick J. Peterson in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Court notes the number of cases and age of oldest case. Defendant indicated he is wanting to have an attorney. Court makes note that if at the next appearance he is without representation Not Guilty pleas should be entered and the matters should be set for trial.
Hearing scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 09:30 am.

10:08 AM cases 22CF553, 21CF118, 20CF1512, 22CF885, 21CF210, 21CF101, 22CF119 called. Prosecuting Attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Derrick J. Peterson in court without counsel. Defendant states he will be hiring a private attorney. Court advises of option to apply with the Public Defender's office. Court notes that Defendant is to have an attorney at next appearance as cases have been pending for awhile.

Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 09/26/2022 at 3:00 PM
Hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 09:30 am.

11:25 AM cases 19CF1694, 20CF1512, 21CF101, 21CF118, 21CF210, 22CF119, 22CF553, 22CF885 called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick J. Peterson appeared by video, in custody with Attorney Sonia Anderson. Warrants have been executed/quashed.
In 22CF553, 22CF885: Waives reading of the complaint. Court orders a $2500 cash bond to cover both files. Time limits for the preliminary hearing are waived. 
In 19CF1964: Court enters a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant and forwards the case to the assigned branch to schedule a jury trial (branch 2). 
In all files except 19CF1964:
Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Return on warrant on August 3, 2022 at 11:00 am.

(Cases 19CF1694, 20CF1512, 21CF101, 21CF118, 21CF210, 22CF119, 22CF553 are called at 3:40 PM) Defendant Derrick J. Peterson not in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Derrick J. Peterson. Attorney Robert Stoiber in court for State of Wisconsin. 
No information for the Court as to the Defendant's non-appearance. State requests warrant with cash. 
Court orders warrant with $5,000 cash bond.
Plea hearing on May 26, 2022 at 03:30 pm.

1:35 PM cases 19CF1694, 20CF1512, 21CF101, 21CF118, 21CF210, 22CF119 called. Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis Ms. in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick J. Peterson not in court.  Attorney Katherine Cook in court for Derrick J. Peterson. Defense has been in contact with the defendant and he is running late. State has no objection to re scheduling. 
A plea hearing is scheduled for 5/26/22 at 3:30 PM.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
Cases called at 11:14 AM: 19CF1694, 20CF1512, 21CF101, 21CF118, 21CF210, 22CF119.
Defendant Derrick J. Peterson appeared in court with Attorney Katherine Cook. Deputy District Attorney Angela Lynn Beranek appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin.
22CF119: Defendant waives reading of Complaint and Time Limits for Preliminary Hearing. $500 Cash Bond Continues.
Attorney Cook indicates that the Defendant would like to waive his right to a jury trial in 19CF1694. Court has colloquy with the Defendant regarding his right to a jury trial and finds the Defendant is freely, voluntarily, and intelligently waiving his right. Jury Trial is removed from the calendar.
Plea Hearing: 4/20/22 at 1:30 PM.

Conditions:  
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety.
Defendant to comply with Pre-Trial Monitoring Services.
(Covers 21CF118, 21CF101, & 21CF210)

Case called at 11:27 AM. Hearing held via Zoom and in person.
Defendant Derrick J. Peterson appeared in court, Attorney Katherine Cook appeared via video.  Attorney Afton Lewis appeared in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney Cook requests that the Initial Appearance be adjourned to ride with this other cases in Br 2 on 3/11/22. Court so orders.
State requests that this case be added to the bond that currently covers (21CF101, 21CF118 and 21CF210). Court so orders.
Initial Appearance: 3/11/22 at 11:00 AM.

Notice of assigned judge. 
Per USPS: Return to sender. 
*New address listed by USPS- notice re mailed.
